Debs Best Recipes  

Tourtiere

Nice and spicy, this main dish goes well with any salad.
1 1/2 lbs lean ground pork                              1 large onion , minced
1 celery stalk, minced                                     1 1/2 tsp pureed garlic & jalapeno
1 1/2 tsp. salt                                                   1/2 tsp coarse black pepper
1/2 tsp thyme                                                  1/2 tsp ground cloves
1/4 tsp ground allspice                                    1 cup beef broth
1 cup instant mashed potato flakes                1 tbs oil
1 cup minced fresh mushrooms                     pastry for a double crust or 8 sheets phylo pastry

Brown pork, onion, mushrooms and celery.  Add garlic and jalapeno, salt, pepper, thyme, cloves and allspice.  Stir well.  Add broth and bring to the boil.  Add potato flakes and reduce heat to simmer, stirring occasionlly until the flakes have thickened the mixture.  Turn off heat.  Cool slightly.  While cooling, make pastry.  Divide pastry into two.  Roll out half the pastry and line a pie tin.  Transfer the pork mixture to unbaked pie shell.  Roll out other half of pastry.Cover the meat mixture.  Put several slits into the top of the pie shell..  Bake 20 minutes at 425.  Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 25 - 30 minutes. 

For phyllo pastry, place 8 sheets one on top ofthe other alternating lengthwise and widthwise and brushing lightly with olive oil between sheets.  Pile the filling in the centre of the phyllo then fold the phyllo sheets up around the filling brushing a little to glue the sheets together.  Bake at 375 until the pastry is browned and crispy.
